title: Understanding the Acute Phase
text: The acute phase is when the symptoms of schizophrenia are most apparent. Think about what symptoms are typically associated with this phase.

title: Positive and Negative Symptoms
text: In the acute phase, both positive and negative symptoms are present. Positive symptoms include hallucinations and delusions, while negative symptoms might involve lack of motivation or withdrawal.

hintAnswer: the disease is most visible and clients exhibit both the positive and negative symptoms of psychosis
title: Identifying the Correct Description
text: Which of the following best describes the acute phase of schizophrenia?
choices: the disease is most visible and clients exhibit both the positive and negative symptoms of psychosis
a quieting of the symptoms, a diminishing of the active symptoms or “clearing,” and more clarity of thought
ongoing assessment and management of active symptoms and how they manifest and impair daily functioning
